intro: Pouzolzia wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish or purple coloration. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments.
